documentation.text: pass in the oracle contract so that it can pull info from it

@dev function that will exchange eth for erc20 tokens
 @param _buyToken the token that you want to buy
@dev this will accept erc20 tokens to be added to the contracts liquidity pool
@dev allows for eth to be deposited into liquidity pool

@dev allows for tokens to be added to the exchange
 this needs to be done before adding any liquidity for the token

attributes.text: pass in the oracle contract so that it can pull info from it

@dev function that will exchange eth for erc20 tokens
 @param _buyToken the token that you want to buy
@dev this will accept erc20 tokens to be added to the contracts liquidity pool
@dev allows for eth to be deposited into liquidity pool

@dev allows for tokens to be added to the exchange
 this needs to be done before adding any liquidity for the token

addEthLiquidity().details: allows for eth to be deposited into liquidity pool

addLiquidity(address,uint256).details: this will accept erc20 tokens to be added to the contracts liquidity pool

allowToken(address).details: allows for tokens to be added to the exchange this needs to be done before adding any liquidity for the token

exchangeEthForToken(address).details: function that will exchange eth for erc20 tokens

params._buyToken: the token that you want to buy

exchangeTokenForEth(address,uint256).details: function that will exchange erc20 tokens for eth

params._sellAmount: amount of tokens that will be sold
params._sellToken: the token that you want to exchange/sell

exchangeTokens(address,uint256,address).details: function that will exchange erc20 tokens

params._buyToken: the token that is going to be purchased you need to enter the rate of each token in the oracle and then function will do the calculations
params._sellAmount: amount of tokens to be sold
params._sellToken: the token that the user wants to sell/trade

constructor.notice: pass in the oracle contract so that it can pull info from it
